body.name: EVEN: A Ham Novel (HAM Action Thrillers Book 2)
body.description: On an isolated stretch of desert highway, Josh Reston is pulled over in the dead of night.By all accounts, he is a quiet, unassuming young man from the woods of Western Pennsylvania with a busted taillight. Until the arresting officer discovers more than a hundred pounds of cocaine and ten thousand dollars in cash stowed in the undercarriage of his vehicle.Brought to jail in the middle of the night, he offers to share everything he knows about the man he works for, Edgar Santos, and the operation Santos runs in exchange for the guaranteed safety of his family back home.Less than two months on the job, the offer reeks of everything Assistant District Attorney Dina Chadwick despises about the legal system. No part of her even wants to consider it, a feeling outweighed only by the intrigue of finally getting something concrete on Santos.Unsure how to proceed, if the claims Reston is making are even true, she decides to step outside the traditional order. Beginning with a simple phone call, she has no idea the person who ultimately answers will be Ham, a woman just recently released from self-imposed exile and aching to get back to doing what she does best.And with more than ample reasons of her own to get Even… Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m getting ready to read the 3rd book of the Ham series. They are soAwesomely riveting- just can’t put them down until the end, and then I don’t WANT them to be finished…!!Love Ham and Mikey- maybe a little romance in the future..? Keep’em coming Mr. Dustin- you are Awsomely talented !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Loved this book, it was a great read. Fast paced, a lot of action. Loved the characters and how things weren't always "perfect.". One thing I didn't understand was why there was so much concern for his brother but not one single thought about the safety of his grandmother. That was the only thing that I kept thinking about.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The HAM story continues in Book 2 of the series. This will keep you wondering what is coming down next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Another good read from Stevens ..I'm enjoying this series called Ham. Looking forward to the other books... great female lead character.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ham not the sandwich.
reviews.reviewText: Never count her down or out. She gets the job done. These books are so different than the Reese and Billie books or the Hawk Tate books. He does a great job writing from a woman’s perspective.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars sloppy sloppy sloppy!
reviews.reviewText: Not your best work by any stretch. I loved the characters. They were fully fleshed out as usual and unusual enough to maximize interest. But the plot was like Swiss cheese, too many holes. For example, we have no clue how Ham found the appliance shop. Pablo drives off into the distance leaving her clueless except to his final destination. And how did he get Josh to come to him without the SafeWord? Too jerky and disjointed. But I still enjoyed it and had trouble putting it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Once again, Ham surprises me. Interesting that Mikey played a role this time. Another good read in the series. Thanks, Dustin Stevens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dustin does it again
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy books with strong women characters. Ham rocks it for sure. Yes there's violence but it's expected with the description of who she is. Part of the story. Both books have been really good. Going for number 3 and hoping there will be more.
Fast paced, intriguing a little gruesome, but hard to put down as it carries you along for the adventure. Hi

Hold onto your book this one is going to be such a thrilling ride through the pages...HAM is back and I am so happy. After book 1 I wasn't sure we would get more HAM but I really hoped so because she is such an amazing, awe-inspiring, kick-ass character HAM is just made for entertaining readers who enjoy an action-packed thriller.I really enjoy the slow build in EVEN, the plot is well written and keeps me turning the pages wondering what's going to happen next or omg what's going to go wrong next...lolThe suspense is anxiety-inducing but in a good way that you just can't put it down until your finished, now I can't wait for more.

The female prodigy is dedicated to defeat criminals and bullying. She is familiar with most modern weapons and surveillance technology. She audaciously attacks much superior enemy forces, such as the drug cartels, resulting in their terror and confusion.
Fairly unrealistic story but, so what? Fast moving and plenty of action. I am a fan of Dustin Stevens.
Again, a 'not for everyone' book but I couldn't put it down. Can't wait for her to come out of early retirement again.
